title: Frank Borman, astronaut who tried to give thrust to Eastern Air, dies at 95
description: At NASA, he commanded Apollo 8, the first manned mission to orbit the Moon and return safely to Earth.

title: Video chat app Omegle closes amid controversy over use by pedophiles
description: Omegle was founded in 2009 to connect strangers online over video chat. Its founder, Leif K-Brooks, acknowledged it was used for “unspeakably heinous crimes.”

title: Big Tech wants AI regulation. The rest of Silicon Valley is skeptical.
description: A growing group of venture capitalists, CEOs and others say artificial intelligence regulation will snuff out competition.

title: Inside an OnlyFans empire: Sex, influence and the new American Dream
description: The fast-growing platform is the creator economy at its most bluntly transactional, where sex is just another unit of content to monetize.

title: Microsoft Outlook can be a pain. 8 ways to make email work for you.
description: Tips, tricks and hacks to help you navigate, use and organize your email on Microsoft Outlook.

title: How India tamed Twitter and set a global standard for online censorship
description: The government has sharply increased the demands it makes of Silicon Valley firms to take down posts and accounts, in particular those that criticize the prime minister and the ruling BJP party.

title: Zuckerberg ‘ignored’ executives on kids’ safety, unredacted lawsuit alleges
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg “ignored” top executives who called for bolder actions and more resources to protect users, especially kids and teens, even as the company faced mounting scrutiny over its safety practices, a newly unredacted legal complaint alleges.
